wikipedia_page.main: Samuel Dickson (1776 – 28 October 1850) was an Irish Peelite politician.After unsuccessfully contesting Limerick City in 1830, Dickson was first elected MP for County Limerick at a by-election in 1849—caused by the removal of William Smith O'Brien who had been found guilty of high treason—but died in office the following year.He was a member of the Union Club.
